member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer
member.summary: Makes a route network analysis layer and sets its analysis properties. A route analysis layer is useful for determining the best route between a set of network locations based on a specified network cost.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The network dataset on which the route analysis will be performed. (In, Required)
Name of the route network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)
The cost attribute to be used as impedance in the analysis. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.in_network_dataset
member.summary: The network dataset on which the route analysis will be performed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.out_network_analysis_layer
member.summary: Name of the route network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.impedance_attribute
member.summary: The cost attribute to be used as impedance in the analysis. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.find_best_order
member.summary: Reorder stops to find optimal route (in, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.ordering_type
member.summary: Specifies the ordering of stops when FIND_BEST_ORDER is used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.time_windows
member.summary: Specifies if time windows will be used at the stops. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.accumulate_attribute_name
member.summary: List of cost attributes to be accumulated during analysis. These accumulation attributes are purely for reference; the solver only uses the cost attribute specified by the Impedance attribute parameter to calculate the route. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.UTurn_policy
member.summary: Restrict or permit U-turns at junctions that could occur during network traversal between stops. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.restriction_attribute_name
member.summary: List of restriction attributes to apply during the analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.hierarchy
member.summary: The parameter is not used if a hierarchy attribute is not defined on the network dataset used to perform the analysis. In such cases, use "#" as the parameter value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.hierarchy_settings
member.summary: Prior to version 10, this parameter allowed you to change the hierarchy ranges for your analysis from the default hierarchy ranges established in the network dataset. At version 10, this parameter is no longer supported and should be specified as an empty string. If you wish to change the hierarchy ranges for your analysis, update the default hierarchy ranges in the network dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.output_path_shape
member.summary: Specifies the shape type for the route features that are output by the analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.start_date_time
member.summary: Specifies a start date and time for the route. Route start time is mostly used to find routes based on the impedance attribute that varies with the time of the day. For example, a start time of 9 AM could be used to find a route that considers the rush hour traffic. The default value for this parameter is 8:00 AM. A date and time can be specified as 10/21/05 10:30 AM. If the route spans multiple days, and only the start time is specified, then the current date is used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.output_layer
member.summary: Network Analyst Layer (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeRouteLayer.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations
member.summary: Adds network analysis objects to a network analysis layer. The objects are added to specific sublayers such as Stops and Barriers. Objects are input as features or records.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Network analysis layer to which the network analysis objects will be added. (In, Required)
The sublayer of the network analysis layer to which the network analysis objects will be added. (In, Required)
The feature class or the table that is the source for the new network analysis objects. (In, Required)
Sets the values for the properties of the network analysis objects. Properties can be set to a constant or mapped to a field from the input feature class or table. (In, Required)

The search tolerance for locating the input features on the network. Features that are outside the search tolerance are left unlocated. The parameter includes a value and units for the tolerance. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.in_network_analysis_layer
member.summary: Network analysis layer to which the network analysis objects will be added. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.sub_layer
member.summary: The sublayer of the network analysis layer to which the network analysis objects will be added. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.in_table
member.summary: The feature class or the table that is the source for the new network analysis objects. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.field_mappings
member.summary: Sets the values for the properties of the network analysis objects. Properties can be set to a constant or mapped to a field from the input feature class or table. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.search_tolerance
member.summary: The search tolerance for locating the input features on the network. Features that are outside the search tolerance are left unlocated. The parameter includes a value and units for the tolerance. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.sort_field
member.summary: A field on which the network analysis objects are sorted as they are added to the network analysis layer. The default is the ObjectID field on the input feature class or the table. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.search_criteria
member.summary: Specifies which sources in the network dataset will be searched when finding locations and what portions of geometry (also known as snap types) will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.match_type
member.summary: The parameter is not used when adding locations to the Line Barriers or Polygon Barriers sublayers. In such cases, use "#" as the parameter value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.append
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to append new network analysis objects to existing objects. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.snap_to_position_along_network
member.summary: Specifies that you want to snap the network locations along the network dataset or at some specified offset from the network dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.snap_offset
member.summary: When snapping a point to the network, you can apply an offset distance. An offset distance of zero means the point will be coincident with the network feature (typically a line). To offset the point from the network feature, enter an offset distance. The offset is in relation to the original point location. That is, if the original point was on the left side, its new location will be offset to the left. If it was originally on the right side, its new location will be offset to the right. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.exclude_restricted_elements
member.summary: Exclude restricted portions of the network (in, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.search_query
member.summary: Specifies a query to restrict the search to a subset of the features within a source feature class. This is useful if you don't want to find features that may be unsuited for a network location. For example, if you are loading centroids of polygons and don't want to locate on local roads, you can define a query that searches for major roads only. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.AddLocations.output_layer
member.summary: Network Analyst Layer (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

The format of the output directions file. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.CreateTurnFeatureClass.spatial_grid_1
member.summary: The Spatial Grid 1, 2, and 3 parameters are used to compute a spatial index and only apply to file geodatabases and certain ArcSDE geodatabase feature classes. If you are unfamiliar with setting grid sizes, leave these options as 0,0,0 and ArcGIS will compute optimal sizes for you. Since no features are written by this tool, the spatial index will be in an unbuilt state. The index will be built when features are written to the feature class such as by the Append tool or editing operations. For more information about this parameter, refer to the Add Spatial Index tool documentation. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.BuildNetwork
member.summary: Reconstructs the network connectivity and attribute information of a network dataset. The network dataset needs to be rebuilt after making edits to the attributes or the features of a participating source feature class. After the source features are edited, the tool establishes the network connectivity only in the areas that have been edited to speed up the build process; however, when the network attributes are edited, the entire extent of the network dataset is rebuilt. This may be a slow operation on a large network dataset.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer
member.summary: Makes a vehicle routing problem (VRP) network analysis layer and sets its analysis properties. A vehicle routing problem analysis layer is useful for optimizing a set of routes using a fleet of vehicles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The network dataset on which the vehicle routing problem analysis will be performed. The network dataset must have a time based cost attribute since the VRP solver minimizes time. (In, Required)
Name of the vehicle routing problem network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)

The time cost attribute used to define the traversal time along the elements of the network. The time cost attribute is required, since the vehicle routing problem solver minimizes time. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.in_network_dataset
member.summary: The network dataset on which the vehicle routing problem analysis will be performed. The network dataset must have a time based cost attribute since the VRP solver minimizes time. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.out_network_analysis_layer
member.summary: Name of the vehicle routing problem network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.time_impedance
member.summary: The time cost attribute used to define the traversal time along the elements of the network. The time cost attribute is required, since the vehicle routing problem solver minimizes time. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.distance_impedance
member.summary: The distance cost attribute used to define the length along the elements of the network. The distance cost attribute is optional. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.time_units
member.summary: The time units used by the temporal fields of the analysis layer's sublayers and tables (network analysis classes). This does not have to be the same as the units of the time cost attribute. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.distance_units
member.summary: The distance units used by distance fields of the analysis layer's sublayers and tables (network analysis classes). This does not have to be the same as the units of the optional distance cost attribute. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.default_date
member.summary: The implied date for time field values that don't have a date specified with the time. If a time field for an order object, such as TimeWindowStart1, has a time-only value, the date is assumed to be the Default Date. For example, if an order has a TimeWindowStart1 value of 9:00 AM and the Default Date is March 6, 2011, then the entire time value for the field is 9:00 A.M., March 6, 2011. The default date has no effect on time field values that already have a date. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.capacity_count
member.summary: The number of capacity constraint dimensions required to describe the relevant limits of the vehicles. In an order delivery case, each vehicle may have a limited amount of weight and volume it can carry at one time based on physical and legal limitations. In this case, if you track the weight and volume on the orders, you can use these two capacities to prevent the vehicles from getting overloaded. The capacity count for this scenario is two (weight and volume). Depending on the problem, you may need to track different types or amounts of capacities. The capacities entered into the capacity fields (DeliveryQuantities and PickupQuantities for the Orders class and Capacities for the Routes class) are space-delimited strings of numbers, which can hold up to the number of values specified in Capacity Count. Each capacity dimension should appear in the same positional order for all capacity field values in the same VRP analysis layer. The capacities themselves are unnamed, so to avoid accidentally transposing capacity dimensions, ensure that the space-delimited capacity lists are always entered in the same order for all capacity field values. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.time_window_factor
member.summary: This parameter allows you to rate the importance of honoring time windows without causing violations. A time window violation occurs when a route arrives at an order, depot, or break after a time window has closed. The violation is the interval between the end of the time window and the arrival time of a route. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.excess_transit_factor
member.summary: This parameter allows you to rate the importance of reducing excess transit time. Excess transit time is the amount of time exceeding the time required to travel directly between the paired orders. The excess time results from breaks or travel to other orders or depots between visits to the paired orders. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.UTurn_policy
member.summary: Restrict or permit U-turns at junctions that could occur during network traversal between stops. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.restriction_attribute_name
member.summary: List of restriction attributes to apply during the analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.hierarchy
member.summary: The parameter is not used if a hierarchy attribute is not defined on the network dataset used to perform the analysis. In such cases, use "#" as the parameter value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeVehicleRoutingProblemLayer.hierarchy_settings
member.summary: Prior to version 10, this parameter allowed you to change the hierarchy ranges for your analysis from the default hierarchy ranges established in the network dataset. At version 10, this parameter is no longer supported and should be specified as an empty string. If you wish to change the hierarchy ranges for your analysis, update the default hierarchy ranges in the network dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer
member.summary: Makes a location-allocation network analysis layer and sets its analysis properties. A location-allocation analysis layer is useful for choosing a given number of facilities from a set of potential locations such that a demand will be allocated to facilities in an optimal and efficient manner.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The network dataset on which the location-allocation analysis will be performed. (In, Required)
Name of the location-allocation network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)
The cost attribute to be used as impedance in the analysis. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.in_network_dataset
member.summary: The network dataset on which the location-allocation analysis will be performed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.out_network_analysis_layer
member.summary: Name of the location-allocation network analysis layer to create. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.impedance_attribute
member.summary: The cost attribute to be used as impedance in the analysis. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.loc_alloc_from_to
member.summary: Specifies the direction of travel between facilities and demand points when calculating the network costs. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.loc_alloc_problem_type
member.summary: The problem type that will be solved. The choice of the problem type depends on the kind of facility being located. Different kinds of facilities have different priorities and constraints. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.number_facilities_to_find
member.summary: Specifies the number of facilities that the solver should locate. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.impedance_cutoff
member.summary: Impedance Cutoff specifies the maximum impedance at which a demand point can be allocated to a facility. The maximum impedance is measured by the least-cost path along the network. If a demand point is outside the cutoff, it is left unallocated. This property might be used to model the maximum distance that people are willing to travel to visit your stores or the maximum time that is permitted for a fire department to reach anyone in the community. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.impedance_transformation
member.summary: This sets the equation for transforming the network cost between facilities and demand points. This property, coupled with the Impedance Parameter, specifies how severely the network impedance between facilities and demand points influences the solver's choice of facilities. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.impedance_parameter
member.summary: Provides a parameter value to the equations specified in the Impedance transformation parameter. The parameter value is ignored when the impedance transformation is of type linear. For power and exponential impedance transformations, the value should be non-zero. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.target_market_share
member.summary: Specifies the target market share in percentage to solve for when the Location-allocation problem type parameter is set to TARGET_MARKET_SHARE. It is the percentage of the total demand weight that you want your solution facilities to capture. The solver chooses the minimum number of facilities required to capture the target market share specified by this numeric value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.accumulate_attribute_name
member.summary: List of cost attributes to be accumulated during analysis. These accumulation attributes are purely for reference; the solver only uses the cost attribute specified by the Impedance attribute parameter to calculate the route. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.MakeLocationAllocationLayer.UTurn_policy
member.summary: Restrict or permit U-turns at junctions that could occur during network traversal between stops. (In, Optional)

member.summary: List of restriction attributes to apply during the analysis. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The parameter is not used if a hierarchy attribute is not defined on the network dataset used to perform the analysis. In such cases, use "#" as the parameter value. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.NetworkAnalystTools.DissolveNetwork
member.summary: Creates a network dataset that minimizes the number of line features required to correctly model the input network dataset. The more efficient output network dataset reduces the time required to solve analyses, draw results, and generate driving directions. This tool outputs a new network dataset and source feature classes; the input network dataset and its source features remain unchanged.
